message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "We analyze the impact of fiscal policy on income inequality in Brazil, using household-level data from PNAD and fiscal data from Finanças do Brasil.", "dataset": ["PNAD", "Finanças do Brasil"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "This study examines the relationship between natural disasters and trade flows by exploiting a panel dataset comprising country-pair observations from 1962 to 2010.", "dataset": ["panel dataset"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management", "Trade"]}, {"sentence": "We explore the effect of renewable energy policies on employment in the United States by using firm-level data from the US Census Bureau's Business Dynamics Statistics and state-level data on renewable energy policies from the Database of State Incentives for Renewables and Efficiency.", "dataset": ["US Census Bureau's Business Dynamics Statistics", "Database of State Incentives for Renewables and Efficiency"], "topic": ["Energy", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "This paper presents the results of an analysis of trends, drivers and challenges of urbanization in India based on the latest data from Census of India, Sample Registration System and National Family Health Survey.", "dataset": ["Census of India", "Sample Registration System", "National Family Health Survey"], "topic": ["Urban Development"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the International Financial Statistics and World Bank Development Indicators, we find that higher financial sector development has significant positive effects on economic growth.", "dataset": ["International Financial Statistics", "World Bank Development Indicators"], "topic": ["Financial Sector", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "To assess the impact of information and communication technologies (ICTs) on poverty reduction, we combine household survey data from LSMS with firm-level data from Enterprise Surveys in developing countries.", "dataset": ["LSMS", "Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Digital Development", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "This study estimates spillover effects of a targeted program to reduce maternal and neonatal mortality in Indonesia, using an event-study design and hospital-level data from the Indonesia Basic Health Research.", "dataset": ["Indonesia Basic Health Research"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "We examine the relationship between rural electrification and agricultural productivity in Sub-Saharan Africa using data from the Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture in Nigeria, Tanzania, and Uganda.", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Energy"]}, {"sentence": "This paper studies the effect of foreign aid on economic growth in African countries using panel data from the World Bank Aid Database and Penn World Tables.", "dataset": ["World Bank Aid Database", "Penn World Tables"], "topic": ["Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "We construct a novel dataset consisting of banking system network for Brazil, based on balance sheet data from Central Bank of Brazil, and use it to analyze the impact of bank regulatory capital on systemic risk of the Brazilian financial system.", "dataset": ["Central Bank of Brazil"], "topic": ["Financial Sector", "Governance"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "We analyze the impact of fiscal policy on income inequality in Brazil, using household-level data from PNAD and fiscal data from Finanças do Brasil.", "dataset": ["PNAD",
